data.meta_site_name: Obituary for Donald Davis | May 16, 2020 | Nacogdoches,TX
data.text:
Don passed away on Saturday, May 16, 2020 at UT Health Tyler in Tyler, Texas at the age of 65. He was born on December 6, 1954 in Corpus Christi, Texas, the son of Ellis and Elvira Davis.

In 1960, the family moved Nacogdoches, Texas.

Don was extremely intelligent with a high I-Q and so remarkable in so many ways. He lived life to the fullest and touched so many people during his time here with us. He loved his family profoundly and was a loving son and big brother.

In high school, Don had so many friends and excelled in academics and sports. He was voted Class Favorite and Friendliest. Don’s passion was playing all kind of sports, with his favorite being baseball. He graduated from Nacogdoches High School in 1973.

Don was appointed to US Air Force Academy in Colorado Springs, CO in 1973. He played baseball for the Academy. He graduated in 1977 and began his career in the Air Force.

Don was diagnosed with a mental illness early in his life.

Don was preceded in death by his father, Ellis “Ed” Davis and his mother Elvira “Vira” Davis.

He is survived by his loving sister, Sandra Perry and his nephews Russell, Wayne and Randall Perry whom he loved dearly.

This poem is a tribute from his sister:

A Wish and a Prayer

May your spirit soar in freedom

From the fears that gripped so tight.

May you find the peace your searched for

As you wandered, lost, in the night.

May your tortured mind be clear and calm

And your tender heart be warm.

May you have no need for strength now.

May there ne’er be another storm.

May the music of the angels

Be the sweet sounds that you hear.

As you’re rocked in Heaven’s cradle

May you ne’er shed another tear.

I’ll wear your memory proudly,

My only brother…my true friend.

May my love for you reach Heaven above

Until we meet again.

Private Interment
